question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示：近年來，很多大學鼓勵教授以英語講授專業課程，請寫一篇英文作文，說明你對這個現象的看法。文分兩段，第一段說明你是否認同這個趨勢並陳述理由；第二段說明如果你未來就讀的大學必修課是以英語授課，你將會如何因應或規劃。
answer:
In recent years, many universities have been encouraging professors to teach professional courses in English, and this trend has sparked a heated debate among educators and students. As a student who is about to enter university, I have been pondering the pros and cons of this phenomenon.

On the one hand, I can understand why universities would want to promote English as the medium of instruction. English has become the lingua franca of the world, and mastering it is essential for success in today's globalized society. By teaching professional courses in English, universities can better prepare their students for the challenges of the global job market. Moreover, English is the language of most academic publications and research, so teaching in English can help students to gain a better understanding of the latest developments in their field.

On the other hand, I have some reservations about this trend. Firstly, not all students are proficient in English, and asking them to learn in a language that is not their native tongue can be a significant challenge. This can lead to a disadvantage for those who are not fluent in English, as they may struggle to keep up with the coursework and miss out on important concepts. Additionally, teaching in English can create a homogenous learning environment that does not reflect the diversity of the student body. This can be detrimental to the learning experience, as students may feel excluded or marginalized if they are not able to fully participate in the class.

If I were to attend a university that offers professional courses in English, I would have to plan and prepare accordingly. Firstly, I would make sure to improve my proficiency in English by taking language courses or practicing with native speakers. This would help me to better understand the course material and participate fully in class discussions. Additionally, I would seek out resources such as language support services or peer tutoring to help me navigate the challenges of learning in a second language.

In conclusion, while I can understand the benefits of teaching professional courses in English, I also have concerns about the potential drawbacks. As a student, I believe that it is essential to be prepared for the challenges of learning in a second language, and to seek out resources that can help me to succeed. Ultimately, the decision to teach professional courses in English should be based on a careful consideration of the potential benefits and drawbacks, and a commitment to creating an inclusive and supportive learning environment for all students.

question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示：每個人或多或少都曾有不經意得罪他人或冒犯他人的經驗，請以個人或親友的經驗為例，寫一篇英文作文。文分兩段，第一段描述事件發生的始末，第二段說明自己或親友如何彌補這個失誤所造成的傷害，並探討這個事件對你的影響或啟示。
answer:
Title: The Regret of Unintentionally Hurting Others

Introduction:

We have all been there, at some point in our lives, where we have unintentionally hurt someone we care about. Whether it was a thoughtless comment, a careless action, or a misunderstanding, these moments can leave a lasting sting and damage our relationships with others. In this essay, I will share a personal experience of unintentionally hurting someone I cared about, and how I made amends for my mistake.

First Paragraph:

One summer, I was out with my friends at a local park, enjoying a picnic and some quality time together. One of my friends, Sarah, had recently lost her grandmother, and we were all trying to be supportive and understanding of her grief. However, in my attempt to be supportive, I accidentally made a thoughtless comment that hurt Sarah deeply. I mentioned that her grandmother was "in a better place" now, which came across as dismissive of her pain and suffering. Sarah was visibly upset, and I could see the hurt in her eyes. I immediately realized my mistake and felt terrible for what I had said.

Second Paragraph:

After the picnic, I reached out to Sarah and apologized for my thoughtless comment. I explained that I had not meant to minimize her grandmother's passing or Sarah's pain, and that I was truly sorry for what I had said. Sarah accepted my apology, but I could tell that the wound was still fresh and sensitive. Over the next few weeks, I made an effort to be more mindful of my words and actions around Sarah, and I made sure to check in on her regularly to see how she was doing. I also offered to help her with any tasks or errands she needed assistance with, as a way of showing my support and care for her.

Conclusion:

Looking back on that experience, I realize that my thoughtless comment had caused unnecessary pain and hurt to someone I cared about. However, by acknowledging my mistake, apologizing sincerely, and making amends, I was able to repair our relationship and show Sarah that I truly cared about her and her well-being. This experience taught me the importance of being mindful of my words and actions, and the power of sincere apologies and effort to make things right. I believe that we all have the ability to make mistakes and hurt others unintentionally, but it is how we choose to respond to those mistakes that truly defines us.

question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示：維護校園安全是校園內每個成員的責任，請寫一篇英文作文，說明應該如何維護校園安全。文分兩段，第一段說明校園安全的重要性及校園內可能發生的安全問題；第二段說明身為校園的一份子，你覺得校內成員應該採取哪些作為以維護校園安全。
answer:
Title: Maintaining Campus Safety: Everyone's Responsibility

Introduction:

As a member of the campus community, it is our collective responsibility to maintain a safe and secure learning environment. With the increasing incidence of violence, bullying, and other safety concerns on college campuses, it is crucial that we prioritize safety and take proactive measures to prevent and address any potential threats. In this essay, I will discuss the importance of campus safety, the potential safety issues that may arise, and what we can do as members of the campus community to maintain a safe and secure environment.

First Section: The Importance of Campus Safety and Potential Issues

Campus safety is of paramount importance, as it directly impacts the well-being and success of students, faculty, and staff. A safe and secure learning environment is essential for students to thrive and reach their full potential. However, campus safety is not just about avoiding danger; it is also about creating a positive and inclusive community where everyone feels valued and respected.

There are several potential safety issues that may arise on campus, including:

1. Violence and harassment: Verbal, physical, and sexual harassment can create a hostile and intimidating environment, making it difficult for students to focus on their studies and participate in campus life.
2. Bullying: Bullying can take many forms, including cyberbullying, and can have a profound impact on students' mental health and well-being.
3. Substance abuse: Drug and alcohol abuse can lead to dangerous situations, such as drunk driving, drug overdoses, and other health risks.
4. Fire safety: Fires can break out in any building, and it is essential that we take precautions to prevent them and know what to do in case of a fire emergency.
5. Cybersecurity: With the increasing use of technology, cybersecurity is becoming a growing concern. We must be aware of the risks of hacking, identity theft, and other cyber threats.

Second Section: What We Can Do to Maintain Campus Safety

As members of the campus community, we all have a role to play in maintaining campus safety. Here are some ways we can contribute:

1. Be aware of our surroundings: We should be mindful of our surroundings at all times, including the people and the environment around us.
2. Report suspicious activity: If we notice anything suspicious or concerning, we should report it to campus security or other authorities.
3. Practice good cybersecurity habits: We should use strong passwords, avoid phishing scams, and keep our devices and software up to date.
4. Participate in safety training: The university should provide safety training and resources to help us prepare for potential safety issues.
5. Look out for each other: We should be aware of our fellow students and colleagues and look out for their well-being.

Conclusion:

Maintaining campus safety is a collective responsibility that requires the participation of everyone in the campus community. By being aware of our surroundings, reporting suspicious activity, practicing good cybersecurity habits, participating in safety training, and looking out for each other, we can create a safe and secure learning environment for everyone. Let us work together to ensure that our campus is a place where everyone can thrive and reach their full potential.

question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示：右表顯示美國18至29歲的青年對不同類別之新聞的關注度統計。請依據圖表內容寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞。文分二段，第一段描述圖表內容，並指出關注度較高及偏低的類別；第二段則描述在這六個新聞類別中，你自己較為關注及較不關注的新聞主題分別為何，並說明理由。

The chart shows that the highest level of interest is in "Entertainment" news, followed by "Sports" news, while "Politics" and "Economy" news receive the lowest levels of interest.

In the first segment, we can see that the youth are most interested in "Entertainment" news, with a whopping 87% of respondents indicating that they pay attention to this type of news. This is likely due to the fact that entertainment news is often more lighthearted and enjoyable to read or watch, as opposed to the more serious and complex topics covered in "Politics" and "Economy" news. Additionally, entertainment news often features celebrities and popular culture, which may be of particular interest to young people.

On the other hand, "Politics" and "Economy" news receive the lowest levels of interest, with only 23% and 26% of respondents, respectively, indicating that they pay attention to these types of news. This is likely due to the fact that these topics can be complex and dry, and may not be of as much interest to young people who are more focused on their social lives and personal interests.

In the second segment, we can see that the respondents who pay more attention to "Entertainment" news tend to be more interested in celebrity gossip and popular culture, while those who pay less attention to "Politics" and "Economy" news may be less interested in current events and more focused on their personal lives. For example, a respondent who is more interested in "Entertainment" news may be more likely to follow the latest celebrity scandals and fashion trends, while a respondent who is less interested in "Politics" and "Economy" news may be more focused on their social media accounts and personal relationships.

Overall, the chart provides insight into the interests and priorities of American youth aged 18 to 29, and highlights the importance of entertainment news and popular culture in their lives.

question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示：如果你就讀的學校預計辦理一項社區活動，而目前師生初步討論出三個方案：（一）提供社區老人服務（如送餐、清掃、陪伴等）；（二）舉辦特色市集（如農產、文創、二手商品等）；（三）舉辦藝文活動（如展出、表演、比賽等）。這三個方案，你會選擇哪一個？請以此為題，寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞。文分兩段，第一段說明你的選擇及原因，第二段敘述你認為應該要有哪些活動內容，並說明設計理由。
answer:
As a student of [School Name], I am thrilled to have the opportunity to participate in a community activity that benefits the local society. After preliminary discussions among my peers and I, we have narrowed down three potential plans for the activity: providing community service for the elderly, organizing a themed market, and hosting art and cultural events.

After careful consideration, I have decided to select the third option, hosting art and cultural events, as the most suitable plan for our community activity. The main reason for my choice is that art and culture are universal languages that can bring people together, regardless of their backgrounds or ages. Moreover, our school is located in a diverse neighborhood with a rich history of art and cultural heritage, which makes this option even more appealing.

In terms of the content of the activity, I believe that we should include a variety of art forms, such as painting, sculpture, music, dance, and theater performances. These forms of art not only showcase the talents of our school's students and faculty but also provide a platform for local artists to display their works. Additionally, we could organize workshops and masterclasses for the community members to learn and engage in different art forms.

The design of the activity should reflect the diversity and inclusiveness of our community. We could set up different zones or areas for each art form, allowing participants to explore and experience different aspects of art and culture. For instance, we could create an outdoor painting zone, an indoor theater performance zone, and a music and dance zone. This design would not only provide a unique and engaging experience for the participants but also showcase the beauty of art and culture in our community.

In conclusion, hosting art and cultural events is the most suitable plan for our community activity. By providing a platform for local artists, showcasing the diversity of our community, and offering engaging and educational activities, we can bring people together and make a positive impact on our society.

question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示：每個人從小到大都有覺得寂寞的時刻，也都各自有排解寂寞的經驗和方法。當你感到寂寞時，有什麼人、事或物可以陪伴你，為你排遣寂寞呢？請以此為主題，寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞。文分兩段，第一段說明你會因為什麼原因或在何種情境下感到寂寞，第二段描述某個人、事或物如何伴你度過寂寞時光。
answer:
Title: The Comfort of Companionship: Overcoming Loneliness

Introduction:
Loneliness is a universal human experience that can strike anyone, regardless of age, gender, or background. As a child, I remember feeling lonely during my summer vacations when my friends were away on their family trips. As an adult, I have experienced loneliness in my personal and professional life, especially during times of change and transition. However, I have learned that there are people, experiences, and objects that can provide comfort and companionship during these moments of loneliness.

First paragraph:
When I was a child, I used to spend my summer vacations at my grandparents' house in the countryside. My friends were away on their family trips, and I found myself alone for long periods of time. I would spend hours reading books, watching TV, and exploring the surrounding woods, but the silence and emptiness of the house made me feel lonely and disconnected from the world. As an adult, I have experienced loneliness in different contexts, such as moving to a new city, starting a new job, or going through a breakup. These experiences have taught me that loneliness is a common human emotion that can be overcome with the help of others.

Second paragraph:
One of the most effective ways to overcome loneliness is to spend time with loved ones. When I feel lonely, I reach out to my family and friends, and we spend time together, sharing stories, laughter, and memories. We support each other, offer advice, and provide a sense of belonging and connection. For example, during my recent move to a new city, I felt lonely and disconnected from my new community. However, my friends and family were always there for me, offering words of encouragement, helping me navigate the new city, and introducing me to new people. Their presence and support helped me overcome my feelings of loneliness and feel more connected to my new surroundings.

Conclusion:
In conclusion, loneliness is a universal human experience that can be overcome with the help of others. Whether it is spending time with loved ones, engaging in hobbies and activities, or seeking professional help, there are many ways to combat loneliness and feel more connected and fulfilled. By acknowledging and addressing our feelings of loneliness, we can build stronger, more meaningful relationships and live more fulfilling lives.

question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示：最近有一則新聞報導，標題為「碩士清潔隊員（waste collectors with a master’s degree）滿街跑」，提及某縣市招考清潔隊員，出現50位碩士畢業生報考，引起各界關注。請就這個主題，寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞。文分兩段，第一段依據你的觀察說明這個現象的成因，第二段則就你如何因應上述現象，具體（舉例）說明你對大學生涯的學習規劃。
answer:
Recently, a news report has caught the attention of many, with the headline "Master's degree holders run streets as waste collectors." The report reveals that in a certain county, 50 master's degree holders have applied for positions as waste collectors, sparking widespread interest and discussion. As an observer of this phenomenon, I believe there are several reasons behind this trend.

Firstly, the current job market is highly competitive, and many graduates are finding it difficult to secure well-paying jobs that match their qualifications. As a result, some are forced to take up any job they can find, regardless of the field or pay. Waste collection, though considered a low-skilled profession, is one such option that is available and in demand.

Secondly, the high cost of education has left many graduates with a significant amount of debt to repay. This financial burden can be overwhelming, and taking up a job as a waste collector may be seen as a means to earn a steady income and start repaying loans.

Lastly, the shift in societal values and the rise of sustainability-focused initiatives have led to a growing demand for waste management professionals. As such, waste collection has become a more desirable career choice, with many seeing it as a way to make a positive impact on the environment.

In light of this trend, I believe that universities and colleges should reassess their curricula and provide more practical training for their students. Rather than solely focusing on theoretical knowledge, institutions should offer courses that teach practical skills such as waste management, environmental conservation, and sustainable development. This will better prepare students for the job market and help them find employment that aligns with their qualifications.

Moreover, universities should also provide career counseling and guidance to their students, helping them understand the current job market and the various career paths available to them. This can include information about the salary ranges, job prospects, and growth opportunities in different fields. By doing so, universities can help their students make informed decisions about their future careers and avoid ending up in low-paying, unfulfilling jobs.

In conclusion, the trend of master's degree holders becoming waste collectors is a symptom of a larger issue in the job market and the education system. To address this issue, universities must adapt their curricula to meet the changing demands of the job market and provide their students with practical training and career guidance. By doing so, they can help their students secure fulfilling and well-paying jobs that match their qualifications.

question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示：指導別人學習讓他學會一件事物，或是得到別人的指導而自己學會一件事物，都是很好的經驗。請根據你過去幫助別人學習，或得到別人的指導而學會某件事的經驗，寫一篇至少120個單詞的英文作文。文分兩段，第一段說明該次經驗的緣由、內容和過程，第二段說明你對該次經驗的感想。
answer:
Learning from Others: A Valuable Experience

As humans, we are constantly learning and growing, and one of the most effective ways to do so is by learning from others. Whether it's through guidance from a mentor, instruction from a teacher, or simply observing and imitating the actions of others, learning from others can be a valuable experience that helps us grow and develop in various aspects of our lives.

In my own life, I have had the opportunity to learn from others in a variety of situations. For example, when I was first starting out in my career, I had a mentor who guided me through the process of learning the ropes and developing my skills. Through their guidance, I was able to gain a deeper understanding of my role and the industry as a whole, and I was able to grow and develop in my career.

Another experience that stands out to me is when I learned how to play the guitar. I had always been interested in playing the guitar, but I had never had the opportunity to learn how. However, when I was in college, I had a roommate who was an accomplished guitar player, and he offered to teach me how to play. Through his guidance and instruction, I was able to learn the basics of playing the guitar, and I was able to develop my skills over time.

Looking back on these experiences, I realize just how valuable they were to my personal and professional growth. Learning from others not only provided me with the knowledge and skills I needed to succeed, but it also gave me a sense of confidence and self-worth. Knowing that I was able to learn and grow through the guidance of others has been a powerful motivator for me, and it has helped me to continue seeking out opportunities to learn and grow throughout my life.

In conclusion, learning from others is an invaluable experience that can provide us with the knowledge, skills, and confidence we need to succeed in various aspects of our lives. Whether it's through guidance from a mentor, instruction from a teacher, or simply observing and imitating the actions of others, learning from others can be a powerful tool for personal and professional growth.

Furthermore, the invisibility cloak could also be used for more recreational activities, such as hiking or exploring new places. By wearing the cloak, I could move about undetected and experience the natural beauty of my surroundings without the fear of being disturbed or encountered by others. This would allow me to fully immerse myself in the experience and enjoy the freedom of being able to explore without any limitations.

In contrast, if I were to choose the smart glasses, I would be limited to the information that they provide and the reliability of that information. While the glasses may offer a comprehensive view of my surroundings, they would not provide the same level of protection or stealth as the invisibility cloak. Additionally, the glasses may not be as accurate or reliable in their information, as they are dependent on the wearer's vision and interpretation of their surroundings.

In conclusion, if given the opportunity to choose between the invisibility cloak and the smart glasses, I would unequivocally select the invisibility cloak. Its ability to render the wearer invisible and provide protection from harm makes it the more practical and versatile of the two products. While the smart glasses may offer a comprehensive view of the wearer's surroundings, they do not offer the same level of protection or stealth as the cloak, making it the superior choice for everyday use.

question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示：請以運動為主題，寫一篇至少120個單詞的文章，說明你最常從事的運動是什麼。文分兩段，第一段描述這項運動如何進行（如地點、活動方式、及可能需要的相關用品等），第二段說明你從事這項運動的原因及這項運動對你生活的影響。
answer:
As an avid runner, I can confidently say that my favorite form of exercise is running. I have been running for several years now, and it has become an integral part of my daily routine. In this essay, I will describe my experience with running, including the location, activity, and equipment I use, as well as the reasons why I enjoy it and how it has impacted my life.

Firstly, I run outdoors, mostly in parks or along the riverbank. I prefer running in nature, as it allows me to connect with the environment and enjoy the scenery around me. I usually run in the morning, when the air is fresh and the streets are quiet. I find that running in the morning helps me to wake up and feel more alert throughout the day.

In terms of activity, I mainly do long-distance running, which involves running for at least 30 minutes non-stop. I find that long-distance running is an excellent way to improve my cardiovascular health and increase my endurance. It also allows me to clear my mind and relieve stress, as I focus on my breathing and the rhythm of my footsteps.

As for equipment, I only need a good pair of running shoes and comfortable clothing. I find that wearing moisture-wicking fabrics and a supportive bra helps to prevent chafing and discomfort during my runs. I also carry a water bottle and a few energy gels to keep me hydrated and energized throughout my runs.

So, why do I enjoy running so much? For one, it gives me a sense of accomplishment and pride in my ability to push myself physically. Running also helps me to relieve stress and anxiety, as it allows me to focus on my breathing and the movement of my body. Additionally, running outdoors allows me to connect with nature and enjoy the beauty of the world around me.

Moreover, running has had a significant impact on my life. It has helped me to develop discipline and perseverance, as I push myself to run further and faster each time. question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示：你認為畢業典禮應該是個溫馨感人、活潑熱鬧、或是嚴肅傷感的場景？請寫一篇英文作文說明你對畢業典禮的看法，第一段寫出畢業典禮對你而言意義是什麼，第二段說明要如何安排或進行活動才能呈現出這個意義。
answer:
Graduation Ceremony: A Meaningful and Memorable Celebration

Graduation ceremony is a significant milestone in one's academic journey, and it holds immense importance for me. It symbolizes the culmination of years of hard work, dedication, and perseverance. As I prepare to graduate, I reflect on the value of this ceremony and how it can be an opportunity for us to celebrate our achievements, connect with our peers, and look forward to the future.

First and foremost, graduation ceremony is a time for us to acknowledge our accomplishments. It is a testament to our ability to overcome challenges, learn from our mistakes, and grow as individuals. For me, this ceremony represents a sense of pride and accomplishment, knowing that I have worked tirelessly to earn my degree. It is a reminder that our efforts have paid off, and we have achieved something significant.

Moreover, graduation ceremony is an opportunity for us to connect with our peers and celebrate our shared experiences. It is a time for us to come together, share stories, and reminisce about the memories we have made during our time in school. For me, this ceremony is a chance to reconnect with my friends and classmates, and to strengthen the bonds that we have formed over the years.

Furthermore, graduation ceremony is a moment for us to look forward to the future. It is a time for us to reflect on our past, but also to look ahead to the possibilities that lie ahead. As we move forward, we must remember that our education is not the end, but rather the beginning of a new chapter in our lives. This ceremony serves as a reminder that we have the skills, knowledge, and experiences to make a positive impact on the world.

To make the most of this ceremony, I believe that we should plan and execute activities that reflect the significance of this occasion. Here are a few suggestions:

1. Personalized speeches: Each graduate should have the opportunity to deliver a personalized speech, sharing their experiences, reflections, and hopes for the future. This will allow us to connect with one another on a deeper level and celebrate our unique perspectives.
2. Cultural performances: The ceremony should include cultural performances that reflect the diversity of our community. This could include music, dance, or other forms of expression that showcase our heritage and traditions.
3. Interactive activities: The ceremony should include interactive activities that allow us to engage with one another and celebrate our achievements. For example, we could have a photo booth, a trivia game, or a group project that brings us together and fosters a sense of community.
4. Personalized gifts: Each graduate should receive a personalized gift, such as a customized plaque or a memory book, to commemorate this special occasion. This will serve as a reminder of our achievements and the memories we have made during our time in school.

In conclusion, graduation ceremony is a meaningful and memorable celebration that holds immense importance for me. It is a time for us to acknowledge our accomplishments, connect with our peers, and look forward to the future. By planning and executing activities that reflect the significance of this occasion, we can make the most of this ceremony and create lasting memories that will inspire us for years to come.

question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示：在你的記憶中，哪一種氣味（smell）最讓你難忘？請寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120字，文分兩段，第一段描述你在何種情境中聞到這種氣味，以及你初聞這種氣味時的感受，第二段描述這個氣味至今仍令你難忘的理由。

As I close my eyes and reflect on my past, one particular smell stands out among the rest - the pungent aroma of my grandmother's homemade cooking. It was a smell that transported me back to my childhood, a time of innocence and joy, and one that I will never forget.

The aroma of her cooking wafted through the air, making my stomach growl with anticipation. It was a smell that was both comforting and familiar, like a warm hug on a cold day. The scent of her homemade pasta sauce, freshly baked bread, and roasted vegetables filled the room, and I knew that I was in for a treat.

To this day, the smell of my grandmother's cooking still lingers in my memory, transporting me back to those happy times spent with my family. It was a time of simplicity and joy, free from the worries and stresses of adulthood. The smell of her cooking reminds me of the importance of family and the value of cherishing the moments we spend together. It is a reminder that even as we grow older and life takes us down different paths, the memories and emotions of our childhood remain with us, shaping who we are and how we view the world.

The reason why this smell remains etched in my memory is not just because of its pleasantness, but because of the emotions it evokes. It reminds me of the love and care that my grandmother showered upon me, the laughter and joy we shared together, and the sense of belonging that I felt in her presence. It is a smell that is inextricably linked to my childhood and my family, and one that I will always treasure.

In conclusion, the smell of my grandmother's cooking is a powerful trigger for my childhood memories, transporting me back to a time of innocence and joy. It is a reminder of the importance of family and the value of cherishing the moments we spend together. Even as we grow older and life takes us down different paths, the memories and emotions of our childhood remain with us, shaping who we are and how we view the world.

question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示：你能想像一個沒有電(electricity)的世界嗎？請寫一篇文章，第一段描述我們的世界沒有了電以後，會是甚麼樣子，第二段說明這樣的世界是好是壞，並舉例解釋原因。
answer:
Imagining a World Without Electricity

In a world without electricity, our daily lives would be vastly different from what we know today. Gone would be the hum of air conditioners, the glow of LED lights, and the constant buzz of our smartphones. Instead, we would be reliant on more traditional sources of light and power, such as candles, lanterns, and wood fires.

At first glance, a world without electricity might seem like a step backward, a return to a more primitive and rustic way of life. But is it really? Would a world without electricity be a better or worse place to live? Let's explore the pros and cons of such a world.

On the one hand, a world without electricity would be a much quieter and more peaceful place. There would be no constant hum of machinery, no blaring of car alarms, and no glow of streetlights illuminating the night sky. Instead, we would be surrounded by the natural sounds of nature, such as the chirping of birds, the rustling of leaves, and the gentle babbling of brooks. This would undoubtedly lead to a more serene and tranquil existence.

On the other hand, a world without electricity would also be a much more challenging and difficult place to live. We would have to rely on manual labor to accomplish even the simplest tasks, such as lighting fires, pumping water, and grinding grain. This would be a significant departure from the ease and convenience of modern life, where we can simply flip a switch or press a button to accomplish the same tasks.

Moreover, a world without electricity would also be a much less connected and isolated place. We would have to rely on face-to-face interactions and written communication, rather than the instantaneous and global reach of the internet. This could lead to a more tight-knit and community-oriented society, but it could also lead to a sense of isolation and disconnection from the wider world.

In conclusion, a world without electricity would be a mixed bag of pros and cons. While it would undoubtedly be a more peaceful and natural existence, it would also be a more challenging and isolated one. Ultimately, the question of whether a world without electricity is better or worse is a matter of personal opinion and perspective. However, it is undeniable that a world without electricity would be a vastly different one, and one that would require us to adapt and evolve in ways that we cannot even imagine today.

question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示︰人的生活中，難免有遭人誤解因而感到委屈的時候。請以此為主題，寫一篇至少120字的英文作文；第一段描述個人被誤解的經驗，第二段談這段經驗對個人的影響與啟示。
answer:
Title: The Misunderstood Life

Introduction:

Life is full of ups and downs, and sometimes, we find ourselves in situations where we are misunderstood by others. This can be a frustrating and hurtful experience, leaving us feeling confused and alone. As someone who has gone through similar experiences, I understand the impact of being misunderstood on our lives. In this essay, I will discuss my personal experiences of being misunderstood and how it has shaped me as a person.

Experience:

One of the most significant experiences of being misunderstood in my life was when I was wrongly accused of something I did not do. I was working on a project with my colleagues, and one of them accused me of not completing my tasks on time. I tried to explain myself, but my words fell on deaf ears. My colleague was adamant that I was at fault, and soon, the entire team was against me. I felt like I was in a nightmare, unable to defend myself or prove my innocence.

The experience was incredibly painful and left me feeling anxious and uncertain. I began to question my abilities and doubt myself, wondering if I was truly cut out for the job. The misunderstanding not only affected my work but also my personal life, as I became withdrawn and isolated. I felt like I was living in a world where no one understood me, and it was a suffocating feeling.

Impact and Realization:

However, as time passed, I realized that the experience had taught me a valuable lesson. I learned that I cannot control how others perceive me or my actions, but I can control how I respond to the situation. I started to focus on my strengths and what I could do well, rather than dwelling on the misunderstanding. I also began to communicate more openly and honestly with my colleagues, making sure they understood my perspective.

The experience also made me more empathetic towards others who may be going through similar situations. I realized that we all have our own struggles and challenges, and it is essential to be understanding and supportive of one another. I learned to listen more carefully and to ask questions before jumping to conclusions.

Conclusion:

Being misunderstood can be a difficult and painful experience, but it can also be a transformative one. It taught me the importance of communication, empathy, and self-awareness. I have learned to focus on my strengths, be more open and honest with others, and to be more understanding and supportive of those around me. The experience has shaped me into a more resilient and compassionate person, and for that, I am grateful.

question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示︰請以 “What Makes A Good Friend?” 為主題，寫一篇至少120個字的英文作文。第一段針對文章主題，說明什麼樣的朋友才算是「好朋友」，並在第二段舉自己的交友經驗為例，以印證第一段的說明。
answer:
What Makes a Good Friend?

A good friend is someone who is always there for you, through thick and thin. They are someone you can rely on, trust, and confide in. Good friends are not just people you hang out with, but they are also the ones who understand you, support you, and accept you for who you are.

Personally, I have been fortunate to have had several good friends throughout my life. One of my closest friends is someone I met in college, and we have been inseparable ever since. She is someone who I can always count on to listen to me, offer advice, and make me laugh. We have been through so much together, from late-night study sessions to crazy adventures, and through it all, our friendship has only grown stronger.

One of the qualities that make a good friend is empathy. A good friend is someone who can put themselves in your shoes and understand how you feel. They are not just someone who listens to you, but they also understand your emotions and perspective. My friend, for instance, is always able to understand when I am going through a tough time, and she knows exactly how to make me feel better. Whether it's a listening ear, a shoulder to cry on, or a much-needed distraction, she always knows what I need.

Another quality of a good friend is trustworthiness. A good friend is someone who you can trust with your deepest secrets, your fears, and your dreams. You can be vulnerable with them, and they will never judge you or betray your trust. My friend, for example, is someone who I can trust with anything. I know that she will never share our conversations or betray my confidences, and that gives me the freedom to be myself around her.

Finally, a good friend is someone who accepts you for who you are, flaws and all. They are not looking for perfection, but they accept you for your unique qualities and strengths. They celebrate your successes and support you through your failures. My friend, for instance, is someone who never judges me for my quirks and imperfections. She accepts me for who I am, and she loves me for it.

In conclusion, a good friend is someone who is empathetic, trustworthy, and accepts you for who you are. They are someone who you can rely on, trust, and confide in, and they are someone who will always be there for you, through thick and thin. If you are lucky enough to have a friend like this, then you are truly blessed.

question: 說明︰依提示寫一篇英文作文，文長至少120個單詞（words）。提示︰請以“Travel Is The Best Teacher”為主題，寫一篇至少120個字的英文作文。第一段針對文章主題，說明旅行的優點，並在第二段舉自己在國內或國外的旅行經驗，以印證第一段的說明。
answer:
Travel Is the Best Teacher

Traveling is one of the most rewarding experiences one can have. It not only broadens one's horizons but also teaches valuable lessons that cannot be learned in a classroom. As the saying goes, "Travel is the only thing you can buy that makes you richer." In this essay, I will discuss the benefits of traveling and how it has taught me valuable lessons.

First and foremost, traveling allows one to experience different cultures and ways of life. When we travel, we are exposed to new customs, traditions, and beliefs that are different from our own. This exposure helps us to understand and appreciate the diversity of the world we live in. For instance, during my trip to Japan, I learned about the importance of punctuality and respect for elders. These values are deeply ingrained in Japanese culture, and experiencing them firsthand taught me the significance of these traits.

Furthermore, traveling provides an opportunity to step out of our comfort zones and challenge ourselves. When we travel, we are forced to navigate unfamiliar places and situations, which helps us to develop problem-solving skills and adaptability. For example, during my trip to Thailand, I had to navigate through crowded markets and communicate with locals who spoke limited English. These experiences helped me to develop my communication skills and build confidence in unfamiliar situations.

In addition, traveling allows us to learn about history and geography in a hands-on way. Visiting historical sites and landmarks provides a deeper understanding of the past and the present. For instance, during my trip to Rome, I visited the Colosseum and the Pantheon, which gave me a glimpse into the city's rich history and architecture.

Finally, traveling provides an opportunity to meet new people and make new friends. When we travel, we are exposed to different perspectives and ways of thinking, which helps us to broaden our understanding of the world. For example, during my trip to Spain, I met a local artist who shared with me his passion for painting and his perspective on life. This encounter not only enriched my travel experience but also inspired me to pursue my own passions.

In conclusion, traveling is an invaluable experience that teaches us valuable lessons about life, culture, and ourselves. It provides an opportunity to step out of our comfort zones, challenge ourselves, and learn about the world around us. As I reflect on my own travel experiences, I am reminded of the importance of exploring new places and cultures, and I am eager to continue my journey as a lifelong learner and traveler.
